alert.note: Alert for Chelan (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 05 at 8:45PM PST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM PST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues. * WHERE...A portion of North Central Washington, including the following county, Chelan. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM PST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 833 PM PST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated significant rainfall over the last 36 hours on top of melting snow. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 0.75 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Leavenworth, Plain, Stehekin, Lake Wenatchee - Mud and rockslides in the steep terrain will be a potential impact as the soil becomes increasingly saturated. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
